issue.title: Failed to parse available VRAM: strconv.ParseInt: parsing "[Insufficient Permissions]"
issue.body:
Hi,

I am trying to run ollama in a docker container with the nvidia runtime on a system with a Nvidia A100 and MIG enabled.
When starting the ollama server I get the following error:

`2023/10/27 09:16:05 routes.go:682: Warning: GPU support may not enabled, check you have installed install GPU drivers: failed to parse available VRAM: strconv.ParseInt: parsing "[Insufficient Permissions]": invalid syntax`

The ollama server is running as root user.

However, when running nvidia-smi inside the container I see the passed through GPU and MIG device and I am also able to allocate the GPU with e.g. pytorch in the same container.

Cuda Version: 12.2
Nvidia Driver Version: 535.104.12
Docker version 24.0.6, build ed223bc
ollama version 0.1.3

Any help is appreciated!

comment.body:
Seems like the problematic call is:

nvidia-smi --query-gpu=memory.free --format=csv,noheader,nounits

Which returns [Insufficient Permissions]

issue.title: Failed to parse available VRAM: strconv.ParseInt: parsing "[Insufficient Permissions]"
issue.body:
Hi,

I am trying to run ollama in a docker container with the nvidia runtime on a system with a Nvidia A100 and MIG enabled.
When starting the ollama server I get the following error:

`2023/10/27 09:16:05 routes.go:682: Warning: GPU support may not enabled, check you have installed install GPU drivers: failed to parse available VRAM: strconv.ParseInt: parsing "[Insufficient Permissions]": invalid syntax`

The ollama server is running as root user.

However, when running nvidia-smi inside the container I see the passed through GPU and MIG device and I am also able to allocate the GPU with e.g. pytorch in the same container.

Any help is appreciated!

comment.body: I've updated this to only build `AVX=on` by default which should maximize performance vs compatibility (until we add runtime-level checks)

commits.message: restore building runner with `AVX` on by default

pull_request.title: allow for a configurable ollama model storage directory
pull_request.body:
- set `OLLAMA_MODELS` in the environment that ollama is running in to change where models are stored
- update docs

```bash
$ OLLAMA_MODELS=/Users/bruce/ollama_models ollama serve
# store models and public keys in /Users/bruce/ollama_models
```

Resolves #228

I'll hold off on merging this until #847 is in to avoid causing that PR pain.

issue.title: Docs request: connecting to front end
issue.body:
Hello ollama, excited to start using this!

I have a docs request:
- How to connect a front end to ollama
- Link example or suggested front ends

Thank you in advance!

commits.message:
Tweaks to `README.md` (#906)

* Mentioned Docker Hub in docs
* Consolidated brew installs to one line

pull_request.title: Documenting OpenAI compatibility (and other docs tweaks)
pull_request.body:
Modernization of https://github.com/jmorganca/ollama/pull/661

- ~Closes https://github.com/jmorganca/ollama/issues/538~
- Upstreams more knowledge from https://github.com/jmorganca/ollama/issues/546
- Simplifies `brew install` to one line
